subject: Thank you for banking with us...Yours In service.
body:
WASHINGTON TRUST BANK (USA)
Address: 717 West Sprague Avenue Spokane,
WA USA
Contact Person: Mr. Peter F. Stanton,
Chairman and CEO
Washington Trust Bank,

Good news about your payment.
            This is to notify you that today being March 4th 2024 the
United States Government has just Approved your  2023 interest funds of
$2,000,000.00 that was generated from your Principals payment of $200
million last year 2023..... They instructed us to release your 2023
interest payment of $2,000,000.00 via Master ATM card so you will have
enough funds to finance your full approved payment of $200 Million.....The
only fees this will cost you is Courrier and insurance fees  of $350.00 to
enable the United States Government  back your ATM CARD and deliver it to
your address successfully.... You are advised to Re-confirm the below so we
will send you your payment that has just been re-approved with ATM CARD
Paymentâ€¦.
Your Full Name:.........
Mobile Phone Number:.....
Current Home Address:.....
Attach any of your active Id .....
You are such a lucky Person !....In God we trust .
Thank you for banking with us...Yours In service.
Mr. Peter F. Stanton Chairman and CEO
Washington Trust Bank.
Phone: +1 509 237 7090
Address: 717 West Sprague Avenue
Spokane, WA U.S.A

subject: Re: Thank you for banking with us...Yours In service.
body:
Hello Mr. Peter F. Stanton,

Thank you for reaching out and sharing this wonderful news with me! I'm thrilled to hear about the approval of my interest funds. It's not every day that one receives such a message.

I have a few questions, if you don't mind, just to make sure I understand everything correctly. Could you please explain how these interest funds were generated? And why is it being delivered via Master ATM card?

Also, could you provide more details about the courier and insurance fees? How are they calculated and what exactly do they cover?

Looking forward to your response.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Laura

subject: Re: Thank you for banking with us...Yours In service.
body:
Hello Mr. Peter F. Stanton,

Thank you for reaching out and sharing this exciting news with me! I'm thrilled to hear about the interest funds that have been approved by the United States Government.

I do have a few questions, though, if you don't mind. Could you please explain a bit more about how these interest funds were generated? And why is it being delivered via Master ATM card?

Also, could you provide some more details about the courier and insurance fees? How are they calculated and what exactly do they cover?

Looking forward to your response!

Best wishes,
Laura

subject: Re: Thank you for banking with us...Yours In service.
body:
Hello Mr. Peter F. Stanton,

Thank you for reaching out and sharing this exciting news with me! I'm thrilled to hear about the approval of my interest funds. It's not every day that one receives such a message.

I have a few questions, if you don't mind, just to make sure I understand everything correctly. Could you please explain how these interest funds were generated? And what does it mean that the United States Government is backing my ATM card?

Also, could you provide more details about the courier and insurance fees? How are they calculated and why are they necessary?

subject: Re: Thank you for banking with us...Yours In service.
body:
Hello Mr. Peter F. Stanton,

Thank you for reaching out and sharing this exciting news with me! I'm thrilled to hear about the approval of my interest funds. It's not every day that one receives such a message.

I have a few questions, if you don't mind, just to make sure I understand everything correctly. Could you please clarify what the "Principals payment" is? Also, could you explain more about how the Master ATM card works?

Regarding the courier and insurance fees, could you provide more details on how these are calculated? 

Lastly, when can I expect to receive the ATM card once everything is settled?

Looking forward to your response.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Laura
